translation.en: -[man 2] Look at it this way… -[woman 5] It's simple to me.
translation.it: - Vedila così… - Per me, è molto semplice.

translation.en: [man 3] I must stay away from…
[woman 6] Feels like the whole city is out today.
[woman 7] Summer sales.
translation.it: I saldi. I newyorkesi non resistono a un buon affare.

translation.en: -Can't keep a New Yorker from a bargain. -[woman 6] Ain't that the truth?
translation.it: I saldi. I newyorkesi non resistono a un buon affare. Com'è vero.

translation.en: Let's get to the toy store and out of this heat.
I'll never hear the end of it if I don't get my niece a doll.
translation.it: Devo prendere una bambola a mia nipote.

translation.en: [woman 7] She asking for some special sort? They have those ones with darling hair you can braid.
translation.it: Ne desidera una in particolare? Alcune si possono persino pettinare.

translation.en: -[woman 6] Yes, maybe she'd like that. -[man 6 whistles] Taxi!
translation.it: Magari sceglierò una di quelle. Ora vediamo.

translation.en: -[woman 6] Oh. -[woman 7] There now, that's better.
[woman 6] Look at that precious little pickaninny one.
-That, she'll love. -No.
[woman 6] She's never even met a colored who didn't work for us. Thank heavens.
translation.it: Conosce solo persone di colore che lavorano per noi.

translation.en: No, never mind, ladies. Accidents will happen.
translation.it: Non disturbatevi. Solo un piccolo incidente.

translation.en: -[woman 6] My goodness. -Here you are.
-[shopper] Here. -[woman 6] Oh! Thank you.
-What a nice lady. -[woman 6] Mm-hmm.
[clerk] There you go, miss. Thank you so much.
-[woman 8] Thank you. -[girl] Mama, I want that one.
[shopper] Do you have the Mother Goose Drawing and Tracing Book?
translation.it: Avete il libro di disegni di Mamma Oca?

translation.en: [clerk] All sold out.
Figures. I've tried all over town. My son won't settle for anything but.
translation.it: Figurarsi. Ho girato tutta la città. Mio figlio vuole solo quello.

translation.en: [clerk] Try again in a couple weeks. Might get lucky.
-His birthday's tomorrow. -[clerk] Well, better luck next time.
translation.it: - Compie gli anni domani. - Avrà più fortuna la prossima volta.

translation.en: [clerk] Thank you.
[man 1] Mister? Hey, are you all right, sir?
Please, somebody, help me. I… I… Help me out.
He's fallen down. Sir, can you hear me?
translation.it: È crollato a terra. Mi sente?

translation.en: [man 2] Sir. Sir, you all right?
-[woman] What's happened? -I don't know.
[woman] He all right?
[driver] This heat. Feels like I'm about to pass out myself.
translation.it: Fa così caldo che rischio di svenire anch'io.

translation.en: Yes. I guess it's tea I need. I'm a little faint.
translation.it: Già. Ci vorrebbe un tè. Mi sento mancare.

translation.en: [driver] The Drayton, ma'am? They do say as how there's always a breeze up there.
translation.it: La porto al Drayton? Lassù c'è sempre una bella brezza, dicono.

translation.en: -[shopper] The Drayton would be lovely. -[indistinct chatter]
[man] Oh! Taxi!
Take him to a hospital.
Thank you.
-Good afternoon. -Good afternoon.
[man 1] The waiter will be with you.
[woman 1 whispering] Stop it.
-Now? -[man 2] Yes, now.
[woman 1] You satisfied?
[man 3] See you later.
[woman 2] Don't be long. I'll get another one.
[man 3] I won't. I hope.
-You'll be all right? -[woman 2] I'll be just fine.
translation.it: - Te la caverai, da sola? - Ma certo.

translation.en: I'm going to sit here and enjoy this cool room.
translation.it: Mi godrò il fresco seduta qui.

translation.en: -[man 3] All right. -[woman 2] All right.
-[man 3] I suppose I should… -[woman 2] I suppose you should.
translation.it: - Ora è meglio che io… - Sì, è meglio.

translation.en: [man 2] We'll be married soon.
As far as they know, we are.
Pardon me. I don't mean to stare, but I think I know you.
translation.it: Chiedo scusa, non intendevo fissare. Ma noi due ci conosciamo.

translation.en: [shopper] I'm afraid you're mistaken.
No, of course I know you, Rene.
You look just the same. Tell me, do they still call you Rene?
translation.it: Non sei cambiata affatto. Dimmi, ti chiamano ancora Reenie?

translation.en: [Irene] Yes, though no one's called me that for a long time.
translation.it: Sì, anche se ormai non capita più da tempo.

translation.en: Don't you know me?
Not really, Rene?
I'm afraid I can't seem to place…
-Clare? -[Clare] Mm-hmm.
That's right.
-Not Clare Kendry? -[Clare] Mm-hmm.
Now, don't run away.
You simply must stay and talk.
Fancy meeting you here. It's simply too lucky.
translation.it: Incontrarci qui… Chi l'avrebbe mai detto!

translation.en: It's awfully surprising, yes.
I'd never have known you if you hadn't laughed.
translation.it: Ti ho riconosciuta solo dalla risata.

translation.en: You've changed so. Well, it's been 12 years at least.
translation.it: - Sei così cambiata. - Beh, sono passati almeno 12 anni.

translation.en: You know, I almost dropped by your father's house not so long ago.
translation.it: Tempo fa, stavo per passare a casa di tuo padre.

translation.en: I've thought of you so often.
-You have? -[Clare] Of course.
You know, since I've been here, I've hoped I might run into someone.
translation.it: È da quando sono qui che spero di imbattermi in qualcuno.

translation.en: Preferably you, though. And now you're here.
translation.it: Te, in particolare. Ed eccoti qui.

translation.en: I'll wager you haven't given me a thought.
translation.it: Tu non mi pensi mai, scommetto.

translation.en: So…
Tell me.
I want to know everything. Married? Children?
translation.it: Voglio sapere tutto. Sei sposata? Hai figli?

translation.en: -Yes. Two boys. You? -Mm-hmm.
One girl. Margery. She's my angel.
translation.it: Una femmina. Margery. Il mio angioletto.

translation.en: My husband John's here on business. Banking business. In this heat! Can you imagine?
translation.it: Mio marito John è qui per affari. Ramo bancario. Con questa afa!

translation.en: That was your husband?
[chuckles softly] We've been here a whole week from Chicago. That's home.
translation.it: Siamo qui da una settimana. Viviamo a Chicago.

translation.en: Although I come here and remember what home really is.
translation.it: Ma è qui che mi sento davvero a casa.

translation.en: Well, we can see lots of one another these days that I'm here, can't we?
translation.it: Beh, ho ancora qualche giorno. Potremmo passare del tempo insieme.

translation.en: I don't know… I mean… I'm just…
I live in Harlem, still.
I don't come to this part of town a whole lot.
translation.it: Non vengo spesso in questa zona.

translation.en: Oh, that's sad.
Perhaps I can come visit with you another time in Harlem?
translation.it: La prossima volta vengo io ad Harlem da te.

translation.en: Meet your boys?
We're here quite often. And if this trip goes well, well, John's quite sure we'll move.
translation.it: Veniamo spesso. Se tutto va bene, John dice che ci trasferiremo qui.

translation.en: It's my dream to come back, Rene.
translation.it: Io non sogno altro che tornare.

translation.en: I'm sure.
does he…
Know?
Let's go up to my suite, where we can talk properly.
Waiter!
Ugh. I can't bear this heat! I have to change.
translation.it: Che caldo insopportabile! Ho bisogno di cambiarmi.

translation.en: John'll be back soon.
And here I am, sweatin' up a storm.
-That's nice. -Oh!
I found Gert Johnson in the phone book. Well, Gertrude Martin now.
translation.it: Ho trovato Gert sull'elenco. Ora è Gertrude Martin.

translation.en: She married Fred. Remember? Yes. I haven't seen Fred for an unmentionable time.
translation.it: - Ha sposato Fred. Te lo ricordi? - Sì, non lo vedo da un'eternità.

translation.en: Well, they have twins. Isn't that wonderful?
-Mmm. -Boys. Oh, I'd love boys.
I'd never risk it again, though.
translation.it: Ma non rischierei mai di nuovo.

translation.en: I went through hell those nine months for fear Margery might turn out dark.
translation.it: Temevo che Margery nascesse scura. Un vero inferno.

translation.en: Mine are dark.
Oh. And your husband, he…
He… couldn't exactly "pass," if that's what you mean.
translation.it: - E tuo marito non… - Cosa? Non potrebbe passare per bianco, se è ciò che intendi.

translation.en: Oh, I thought…
Oh, well, then. [chuckles]
Would you?
Would you?
Well, anyway, she goes as white.
translation.it: Beh, mia figlia passa per bianca.

translation.en: -So, you haven't ever thought to? -What?
translation.it: - Tu non ci hai mai pensato? - A cosa?

translation.en: I'm asking if you ever thought of passing, Rene.
No, why should I?
I mean, for convenience, occasionally, I suppose. But no.
translation.it: Insomma, qualche volta lo faccio. Per comodità. Ma non mi interessa.

translation.en: I just mean I have everything I've ever wanted.
translation.it: Ho già tutto ciò che potrei desiderare.

translation.en: Except perhaps a little more money. [scoffs]
translation.it: Tranne forse qualche soldo in più.

translation.en: Of course. That's all anybody ever wants, a little more money.
translation.it: Certo, come tutti. Chi non desidera qualche soldo in più?

translation.en: Money's an awfully nice thing to have.
translation.it: È così piacevole avere del denaro.

translation.en: In fact, all things considered, I think it's entirely worth the price.
translation.it: Tanto che, secondo me, vale decisamente qualsiasi sacrificio.

translation.en: I should go, Clare.
I'm not sure it's such a good idea if John…
translation.it: Non vorrai che John mi trovi…

translation.en: Oh, no, Rene, it is.
translation.it: No, Reenie. Non è un problema.

translation.en: Oh, you must stay a little while longer. Oh, please say you'll stay.
translation.it: Resta ancora un po'. Ti prego.

translation.en: Hang it! I've made a mess.
Give me a second, and I'll order us some food up here.
translation.it: Dammi un secondo e ordino qualcosa da mangiare.

translation.en: All right.
Whatcha thinking, Rene?
You're curious, is that it?
You can ask me anything. Anything you want.
translation.it: Chiedimi pure tutto ciò che vuoi.

translation.en: What have you told him… of your family?
translation.it: Cosa gli hai detto della tua famiglia?

translation.en: You know, I haven't had to worry as much as you'd think.
translation.it: Non mi sono dovuta preoccupare poi tanto di questo.

translation.en: There were my aunts, you see. They took me in after Father died and gave me a home of sorts.
translation.it: C'erano le mie zie. Morto mio padre, mi hanno accolta a casa loro.

translation.en: [exhales deeply] Very white, very respectable, very religious.
translation.it: Così bianche. Così rispettabili. Così religiose.

translation.en: I met John not long after,
and as soon as I turned 18 and legal, we got married and…
translation.it: Appena raggiunta la maggiore età, l'ho sposato e…

translation.en: well, went off and left for good.
And you're happy?
Of course, Rene.
As you say, I have everything I ever wanted.
translation.it: Come te, ho tutto ciò che potrei desiderare.

translation.en: I'm sorry, Clare, that was rude of me.
Of course you're happy.
-Look at you. -[Clare chuckles]
-And your daughter? -Margery? Oh, she's divine.
translation.it: - E tua figlia? - Margery? È straordinaria.

translation.en: John wants to put her in one of those Swiss boarding schools in the fall.
translation.it: In autunno, John vuole mandarla in un collegio in Svizzera.

translation.en: I dare say she'll get quite the education. Not like anything we had.
translation.it: Lì riceverà un'istruzione eccellente. Non come noi due.

translation.en: Room service, hello?
We want cakes. The most beautiful cakes you have.
translation.it: Vogliamo dei dolci. I dolci più belli che ci siano.

translation.en: Tell me, what tea you got passes for French champagne?
translation.it: Mi dica, che tipo di tè avete che possa passare per champagne?

translation.en: Oh, I'm messing!
Yes, we'll take a pitcher of iced tea in champagne flutes.
translation.it: Sì, vorremmo una brocca di tè freddo e dei calici da champagne.

translation.en: Mm-hmm. We're celebrating.
-[Irene] That's enough, thank you. -Have a drop more. You've hardly had any.
translation.it: - Basta, grazie. - Ma ne ho messo solo un goccio!

translation.en: -[John] Nig? -John, dear! [kisses]
I ran into an old, old friend of mine from school.
translation.it: Ho incontrato una mia vecchia compagna di scuola.

translation.en: Irene Westover. Irene, this is my husband, John Bellew.
translation.it: Irene Westover. Irene, lui è mio marito, John Bellew.

translation.en: Pleasure to meet you, Mrs. Westover.
-Actually, it's Mrs. Redfield. -[John] Mm.
Oh, of course, I… I didn't even think to ask.
translation.it: Ma certo. Non ho neanche pensato di chiedertelo.

translation.en: I am sorry if I've interrupted.
-Will you get me a drink, honey? -[Clare] Here.
translation.it: Mi dai da bere, tesoro? - Tieni. - Grazie.

translation.en: [John] Thank you.
So, what do you say, then? To old friends?
translation.it: A cosa brindiamo? Ai vecchi amici?

translation.en: -To old friends! -To old friends.
translation.it: - Ai vecchi amici! - Ai vecchi amici.

translation.en: -Did you hear what John called me, Rene? -Oh, Clare, please.
translation.it: - Hai sentito come mi ha chiamata John? - Ti prego.

translation.en: [Clare] No, go on, tell her why.
[John chuckles] Oh, it's silly.
When we were first married, this woman was as white as a lily.
translation.it: Appena sposati, Clare aveva la pelle candida come la neve.

translation.en: But as the years go by, she seems to be getting darker and darker.
translation.it: Ma più passano gli anni e più sembra diventare scura.

translation.en: So I told her, "If you don't look out, you'll wake up one morning and find that you've turned into a nigger."
translation.it: Così le ho detto: "Attenta. Un giorno potresti risvegliarti negra".

translation.en: Yeah. She's been Nig ever since.
translation.it: E da allora la chiamo così.

translation.en: That's good!
Well, it's silly.
No, that's… That's…
That's good.
My goodness, John!
After all these years, what would it matter if you found out that I was 1 or 2% colored, hmm?
translation.it: Dopo tanti anni, cambierebbe qualcosa se scoprissi che ho un po' di sangue nero?

translation.en: Well, you can turn as black as you please, as far as I'm concerned.
translation.it: Per me puoi diventare scura di pelle quanto vuoi.

translation.en: I know you're not colored.
translation.it: So che non sei di colore.

translation.en: So, you dislike Negroes, Mr. Bellew?
No, no, no, not at all. I hate them.
translation.it: No, non direi questo. Li odio proprio.

translation.en: But not as much as Nig does, for all she's trying to turn into one.
translation.it: Ma mai quanto li odia lei, anche se vuole tramutarsi in una di loro.

translation.en: Why, she won't have them near her, not even as a maid.
translation.it: Non li vuole vicino neanche come domestici.

translation.en: Isn't that true?
Have you ever known any Negroes?
[John] No, no, but I do know people who know them.
translation.it: No, ma conosco gente che li conosce.

translation.en: And I read about them in the papers, of course.
translation.it: E ho letto di loro sui giornali.

translation.en: Terrible mess. Robbing, killing.
[sighs] It's sad, really.
John, Rene doesn't want to hear about your pet perversions.
translation.it: John, dubito che a Reenie interessino le tue personali avversioni.

translation.en: I'm sorry, I didn't mean to bore you.
You live nearby?
Fairly.
[John] It's a great city, New York. City of the future.
translation.it: New York è una gran bella città. La città del futuro.

translation.en: -What line of work is your husband in? -He's a doctor.
translation.it: - Di cosa si occupa suo marito? - È medico.

translation.en: -[John] That's an interesting life. -[Irene] Yes. Hard. Nerve-racking too.
translation.it: - Vita interessante, quella del medico. - Sì. Dura. Snervante.

translation.en: Wife's nerves, too, I bet. All those lady patients.
translation.it: Snervante pure per la moglie. Con tutte quelle pazienti…

translation.en: John, dear, don't start! More tea, Rene?
translation.it: John, amore, non cominciare! Altro tè, Reenie?

translation.en: I've taken up too much of your time already.
translation.it: Vi ho già portato via fin troppo tempo.

translation.en: Oh, but we're just getting started!
-Thank you for the drink. -[John] I'll see you out.
translation.it: - Grazie per il tè. - La accompagno.

translation.en: [Clare] Rene.
-I do hope to see you soon. -Goodbye, Mrs. Redfield.
translation.it: Rivediamoci presto. Arrivederci, sig.ra Redfield. È stato un piacere.

translation.en: -Glad to have met you. -[Irene] Goodbye, Clare.
translation.it: Arrivederci, sig.ra Redfield. È stato un piacere. Arrivederci, Clare.

translation.en: -[Irene] Evening, Lance. -Evening.
Where you been?
Lookin' for that darn book.
-They eat? -I think so.
I was gonna put them to bed, but…
-But you fell asleep. -Apparently.
Am I still sleeping?
Catch it!
Pass, pass.
[husband] Hey. Come here.
-I thought you nailed this already. -[son 1] I forget sometimes.
translation.it: - Non avevi imparato? - A volte mi dimentico.

translation.en: [husband] All right, ten minutes.
-[son 1] Catch the ball, okay? -[son 2] I don't want to.
translation.it: - Prendi la palla. - Non mi va.

translation.en: [son 1] Don't lose it.
It's boring. Play with me.
translation.it: Così mi annoio. Gioca con me.

translation.en: [son 2] Just leave me alone.
Damn!
-Caught! -[gasps] Damn it!
Brian, why you gotta be creepin' around the place like that? Profanity, miss!
translation.it: - Brian, odio quando fai così. - Non nominare il nome di Dio invano.

translation.en: They'll be late for school.
translation.it: Loro faranno tardi a scuola e io da un paziente,

translation.en: I'm not gonna have time to make it to my next call if I have to drop you.
translation.it: Loro faranno tardi a scuola e io da un paziente, se devo accompagnarti.

translation.en: -[maid] Boys, come on in. -Irene?
[maid] Yes, yes, you have to come on in now.
Sorry, honey.
I was just thinking how much Junior is getting like you.
translation.it: Junior ti somiglia sempre di più, sai?

translation.en: I wonder if he isn't going too fast in school. It's easy to forget he's younger.
translation.it: Forse, a scuola, corrono troppo per lui. È più piccolo.

translation.en: I wish you wouldn't be ever fretting about those boys.
translation.it: Vorrei che non ti preoccupassi tanto per i ragazzi.

translation.en: They are fine. They're perfectly good, strong, healthy boys.
translation.it: Se la cavano bene. Sono bravi, forti e in salute.

translation.en: I suppose.
I'm just afraid he's picked up some queer ideas about things from some of the older boys.
translation.it: Spero solo che quelli più grandi non gli inculchino idee bizzarre.

translation.en: "Queer"? What about?
You know, things young boys be thinking about.
translation.it: Beh, su quello a cui pensano gli adolescenti.

translation.en: Ah. You mean about sex?
Yes. Jokes. Things like that.
If sex isn't a joke, what is it?
translation.it: Il sesso non è una barzelletta?

translation.en: -What is a joke? -Don't be facetious.
translation.it: Allora cosa lo è? Non fare lo spiritoso.

translation.en: You ready?
No, you go. I'll take the bus.
translation.it: Voi andate pure. Io prendo l'autobus.

translation.en: -Pick you up, then? -Please. From the printing office.
translation.it: - Ti passo a prendere, allora? - Sì, grazie. In tipografia.

translation.en: I need to see about more handbills and tickets for the dance.
translation.it: Servono più volantini e biglietti per il ballo.

translation.en: They should be paying you.
It isn't charity work if they pay me for it.
translation.it: Non sarebbe beneficenza, se lo facessero.

translation.en: -[maid] Go on, boys. -[Brian] Are we ready?
[Irene] Lickety-split!
-Come back. -Are you ready?
-I'm fast. -Let's go.
-Go on, boys, get. -Junior.
-[son 2] I don't wanna go! -[Brian] You have to, I'm afraid.
translation.it: - Non ci voglio andare! - Ma devi.

translation.en: [Junior] Bye, Mama.
-I'm too fast! Can't catch me. -[son 2] Get back here.
-You want grapefruit, ma'am? -Mm-hmm.
Thank you.
Ugh, my hat.
Oh, Ms. Redfield, you forgot one.
Thank you.
-Do you want me to drive? -Mmm.
Yeah, sure.
Everything set?
We're a month away and all the bookings are gone, not counting the door.
translation.it: Manca un mese e i biglietti sono già tutti esauriti.

translation.en: -Busy as a cat with fleas myself. -Ain't you cold?
translation.it: - Anch'io ho fin troppo lavoro. - Non hai freddo?

translation.en: No, leave it, if you're not cold.
translation.it: No, lascia, se non hai freddo.

translation.en: [sighs] This city!
I think I'm beginning to hate sick people.
Their stupid meddling families, their dirty, smelly rooms--
translation.it: Familiari che si intromettono, luride stanze maleodoranti…

translation.en: Come on, now. It's just a bad day.
translation.it: È stata solo una brutta giornata.

translation.en: You don't mean that. You're helping those sick people.
translation.it: Non dici sul serio. Tu aiuti i malati.

translation.en: -Let's not talk about it. -You brought it up.
-Put the window down. -Thought you were cold.
translation.it: Abbassa il finestrino. - Non avevi freddo? - Ora non respiro. Abbassalo.

translation.en: Now I'm saying I can't breathe. Put the window down.
translation.it: - Non avevi freddo? - Ora non respiro. Abbassalo.

translation.en: I know you think trying somewhere else would be easier for us.
translation.it: So cosa pensi. Sarebbe più facile vivere altrove.

translation.en: South America or some such. And to a point, I agree.
translation.it: In Sudamerica, magari. E forse ci farebbe bene andare all'estero.

translation.en: We should go abroad somewhere.
translation.it: E forse ci farebbe bene andare all'estero.

translation.en: Not for a while, of course, but when the boys leave…
translation.it: Non adesso, ovviamente. Cresciuti i ragazzi.

translation.en: -We can visit Brazil. -Visit?
translation.it: - Un giro in Brasile. - Un giro?

translation.en: Or I was thinking of one of them European schools for Junior.
translation.it: O magari pensavo a una scuola europea per Junior.

translation.en: You are going to make a mollycoddle out of that boy.
Ted is the one who needs your attention, not Junior,
translation.it: È Ted che ha bisogno di attenzioni.

translation.en: and you needn't think I'll let you send Junior to some nice kindergarten school
translation.it: E non ti permetterò di mandare Junior in qualche scuola per bambocci

translation.en: 'cause he's getting a much-needed education.
translation.it: solo perché sta imparando cos'è la vita.

translation.en: Sooner he learns about sex, the better. Certainly if he learns it's a grand joke. The greatest in the world.
translation.it: È bene che scopra il sesso e che impari che è la più grande barzelletta al mondo.

translation.en: -What's that supposed to mean? -Nothing.
I'm just getting a little tired of playing second fiddle
translation.it: È solo che sono stufo di venire sempre dopo la tua preziosa Negro League.

translation.en: to your precious Negro League, that's all.
translation.it: che sono stufo di venire sempre dopo la tua preziosa Negro League.

translation.en: How about a little charity for this Negro?
translation.it: E un po' di beneficenza per me?

translation.en: [Irene] Come on, now. There's people looking.
What's this?
-I think it's from Clare Bellew. -Clare Bellew?
translation.it: - È di Clare Bellew, credo. - Clare Bellew?

translation.en: [grunts] That woman from Chicago you told me about running into?
translation.it: La donna di Chicago che hai incontrato?

translation.en: -Mm-hmm. -You gonna see her again?
I haven't opened the letter.
-It's postmarked New York. -I know.
translation.it: - Ha il timbro di New York. - Sì.

translation.en: -They must've moved here. -Brian, I'm not going to see her.
translation.it: - Avranno traslocato qui. - Non intendo rivederla.

translation.en: Thought you were good friends in school.
translation.it: Non eravate buone amiche a scuola?

translation.en: Brian, darling, I'd have to be an idiot not to realize

translation.en: No. It's simply the rest of you are so clever, I'm speechless.
translation.it: No. È solo che siete tutti così arguti che sono senza parole.

translation.en: You haven't a drink. What will you take?
Ginger ale and three drams of scotch. Scotch first, then the ice, then the ginger ale.
translation.it: Ginger ale e tre shot di whisky. Whisky, poi ghiaccio, poi ginger ale.

translation.en: [Felise] Don't attempt to mix that yourself, Dave, honey.
translation.it: Non provare a farglielo tu, Dave, tesoro.

translation.en: -Have the butler make it. -[Irene] And the footman, would you?
translation.it: - Chiama il maggiordomo. - E anche il lacchè.

translation.en: -Yes, it's a perfect evening. -Good.
[Dave] Don't stand there. Aren't you freezing?
translation.it: Non stare qui fuori. Non hai freddo?

translation.en: [Dave] Come. Come talk to me, or at least listen to me gabble.
translation.it: Vieni a fare due chiacchiere. O almeno ad ascoltare me che chiacchiero.

translation.en: -[man 1] Evening, can I help you? -[John] Let me in.
[man 1] Perhaps you've come to the wrong house. [John] I know where I am. Let me in.
translation.it: - Non avrà sbagliato casa? - Non ho sbagliato. Fammi entrare.

translation.en: [man 2] Which apartment are you looking for, sir?
-[John] My wife is in there. -[man 1] Your wife?
translation.it: - Mia moglie è qui. - Sua moglie?

translation.en: No, sir, she's not here. I guarantee it.
translation.it: No, le assicuro che non c'è.

translation.en: -[man 2] Excuse me, I think you're wrong. -[John] I'm not wrong.
translation.it: - Credo che sia in errore. - Assolutamente no.

translation.en: -[man 1] Do not come in! -[man 2] Sir, calm down.
-[man 3] What's going on? -[John] Out of my way.
Can I help you?
[John] I've been to the Redfields' and I know she's with them.
translation.it: Sono stato a casa dei Redfield. So che è qui.

translation.en: Ralph, where's my drink?
[John] Save yourself the trouble and get out of my way.
translation.it: Risparmiate il fiato e fatemi passare.

translation.en: I know what you're doing here. I know.
translation.it: So cosa fate, qui. Lo so.

translation.en: I'm Redfield. What the devil's the matter--
translation.it: Sono Redfield. Qual è il problema?

translation.en: You don't get to tell me what to do! Any of you people!
translation.it: Non voglio sentire una parola! Da nessuno di voi!

translation.en: [Dave] It's best you leave.
You liar!
[Felise] Careful. You're the only white man here.
translation.it: Stia attento. È l'unico bianco, qui.

translation.en: You dirty liar.
-Good Lord Jesus! -[indistinct chatter]
-[man 1] Hurry. -[man 2] Quickly!
Quickly!
Go downstairs.
[man 1] Her husband's just sitting there?
translation.it: E il marito sta seduto lì?

translation.en: [man 2] I don't know.
[man 1] You don't know? [man 2] I don't know for sure if she's dead.
translation.it: - Che vuoi dire? - Non sono certo che sia morta.

translation.en: [man 3] I imagine he was just trying to protect his wife. [man 4] Doesn't strike me as particularly unusual.
translation.it: Voleva proteggere la moglie, immagino. Non lo trovo particolarmente strano.

translation.en: [Irene] Is she…
Is she…
Irene, you mustn't.
You'll make yourself sick.
[man 3] I mean, she just tumbled over and was gone.
translation.it: È caduta ed è finita giù.

translation.en: [Dave] Irene was there beside her, weren't you? [officer] This lady here?
translation.it: - Irene era vicino a lei. Vero, Irene? - Questa signora?

translation.en: You're sure she fell?
Her husband didn't give her a shove or anything, as Dr. Redfield here seems to think?
translation.it: Il marito non l'ha spinta né altro, come sostiene il dott. Redfield?

translation.en: No. I'm quite sure she just fell before anyone could stop her.
translation.it: No, è caduta prima che qualcuno potesse fare nulla.

translation.en: It was so quick, I…
-Careful. -[officer] Anyone else notice anything?
translation.it: - Attenta. - Nessun altro ha notato niente?

translation.en: -You mustn't. -[officer] None of you saw how she fell?
-[Felise] He was upset, that's true. -[officer] So an accident?
translation.it: - Era turbata. - Quindi è stato un incidente?

translation.en: [Felise] I guess an accident, yeah.
That's what I thought.
[whispers] I love you.
[officer] Death by misadventure, I'm inclined to believe.
Let's go up and have a look at that window.
